{"blocks":[{"key":"ffd5l","text":"Set up a series of test reactions with the appropriate amount of input DNA, and different final concentrations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e9jiv","text":"of Conditioning Solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5luse","text":"Include at least one reaction with the same input of control DNA known to be EDTA-free. The control DNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51sta","text":"should preferably be of the same type and quality as the test samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fpqtc","text":"Fragment the DNA using the appropriate parameters, as outlined in the Library Construction Protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk9ul","text":"Enzymatic Fragmentation (step 1). Complete the library construction process, and compare library size","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fa18b","text":"distributions for the test and control samples using an electrophoretic system (see Important Parameters:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7c1oi","text":"Evaluating the Success of Library Construction, p. 8).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6n3v7","text":"Titrate the final concentration of Conditioning Solution in the reaction until the test samples yield similar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clm4q","text":"fragmentation profiles as the EDTA-free control sample, or until the desired library size distribution has been","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36pk5","text":"achieved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4otu4","text":"A two-step strategy may be the best. Start with 3 – 4 test samples covering a broad range of final Conditioning","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qirm","text":"Solution concentrations, then perform a finer titration over a narrower concentration range.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

If necessary, the protocol may be paused safely after completion of the Post-ligation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agrlf","text":"Cleanup (step 4.17; the end of the protocol for PCR-free workflows). Purified, adapter-ligated library DNA may be stored at 2°C to 8°C for 1 – 2 weeks, or at -15°C to -25°C for ≤1 month before amplification, target capture and/or sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gb7t","text":"To avoid degradation, always store DNA in a buffered solution (10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0 – 8.5) when possible,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c8m71","text":"and minimize the number of freeze-thaw cycles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cas0g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4c562","text":"Notes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vmk","text":"First-time users should refer to Appendix 2: Optimization of Fragmentation Parameters (p. 16)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtk3q","text":"before trying this kit, as standard fragmentation parameters may not result in the optimal size distribution","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bio1","text":"for libraries prepared from your specific DNA samples. Precious samples should not be used when evaluating","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cm80n","text":"this kit. Instead, parameters should be optimized with a non-precious, bulk DNA sample that is representative","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aasj","text":"of the actual samples to be processed. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1mfl0","text":"If your DNA samples contain EDTA, please consult the Appendix 2: Handling of DNA Samples Containing EDTA (p. 16), as well as Important Parameters: Input DNA (p. 4) before starting this protocol. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmvg5","text":"This protocol does not include size selection. Please refer to Appendix 1 (p. 15) for a detailed double-sided","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8obta","text":"size selection protocol that may be included after ligation or after amplification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqe78","text":"Always ensure that KAPA cleanup beads are fully equilibrated to room temperature and fully resuspended","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5npd8","text":"before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
